content.title: Best-Selling Console
content.description: The PlayStation 2 is the best-selling video game console of all time, with over 155 million units sold worldwide. It dominated the gaming market for over a decade.

content.title: Released in 2000
content.description: The PS2 was released in Japan on March 4, 2000, and later in North America on October 26, 2000. It was Sony's second home video game console.

content.title: Backward Compatibility
content.description: The PS2 was backward compatible with almost all PlayStation 1 games, allowing players to enjoy their existing game library on the new console.

content.title: DVD Technology
content.description: The PS2 was one of the first affordable DVD players on the market, making it a popular choice for home entertainment beyond just gaming.

content.title: Emotion Engine
content.description: The PS2 featured the Emotion Engine processor, a custom 128-bit CPU that delivered impressive graphics and performance for its time.

content.title: DualShock 2 Controller
content.description: The DualShock 2 controller featured pressure-sensitive buttons, allowing for more nuanced gameplay control and enhanced gaming experiences.

content.title: 13 Years of Production
content.description: The PS2 had an incredible lifespan, with production continuing until January 4, 2013 - over 13 years after its initial release. This makes it one of the longest-running console generations.

content.title: Online Gaming
content.description: With the Network Adapter accessory, the PS2 enabled online multiplayer gaming, paving the way for modern online gaming experiences.
